alert.note: Alert for Bureau; Putnam (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued November 05 at 9:31AM CDT until November 05 at 10:15AM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: The National Weather Service in the Quad Cities has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Putnam County in north central Illinois... Eastern Bureau County in north central Illinois... * Until 1015 AM CDT. * At 931 AM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from Normandy to near Sparland, moving northeast at 50 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Severe thunderstorms will be near... Walnut around 935 AM CDT. Lake Thunderbird around 940 AM CDT. McNabb and Magnolia around 945 AM CDT. Hennepin, Granville, Bureau Junction, Mark and Florid around 950 AM CDT. Other locations in the path of these severe thunderstorms include DePue, Seatonville, Standard, Hollowayville, Spring Valley Airport, Ottville, Spring Valley, Ladd, Dalzell and Cherry. TORNADO...POSSIBLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
